title: Max Z. Li - Industrial & Operations Engineering
snippet: Max is an Assistant Professor of Aerospace Engineering at the University of Michigan, Ann Arbor. He also has courtesy appointments in Civil and Environmental Engineering as well as Industrial and Operations Engineering. Max received his PhD in Aerospace Engineering from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology in 2021.

title: Faculty Profile: Max Li on a fear of flying, mentoring students, and ...
snippet: Max Li is currently a Visiting Assistant Professor in the Aerospace department and begins his role as an Assistant Professor in the Fall of 2022. He comes to us from MIT, where he finished his PhD in 2021 after attending the University of Pennsylvania for his undergraduate and master's degrees. title: Max Li Profile - University of Michigan
snippet: Max is an Assistant Professor in the Department of Aerospace Engineering and the Department of Industrial and Operations Engineering at the University of Michigan, Ann Arbor. His research and teaching interests include air transportation systems, airport and airline operations, Advanced Air Mobility (AAM), networked systems, optimization, and ...
